notes.markdown: Edward N. Peters, 'Plastics: Thermoplastics, Thermosets, and Elastomers,' Handbook of Materials Selection, New York: John Wiley & Sons, Inc. (2002), pp. 363–365
Günter Joseph, 'Copper: Its Trade, Manufacture, Use, and Environmental Status,' edited by Konrad Kundig, ASM International (1999), pp. 141–192 and pp. 331–375.
Manfred Stickler, Thoma Rhein 'Polymethacrylates,' Ullmann's Encyclopedia of Industrial Chemistry (2000).
John W. Anthony, Richard A. Bideaux, Kenneth W. Bladh, Monte C. Nichols, eds. 'Nickel,' Handbook of Mineralogy. Vol. I. Chantilly, Virginia, US: Mineralogical Society of America (1990).

overview.name: Aluminum
overview.description: Aluminum is a low-density metal visually similar to silver, both in its color and in its great ability to reflect light. It is soft, nonmagnetic and ductile.

notes.markdown: John E. Hatch, 'Aluminum : properties and physical metallurgy,' Metals Park, Ohio: American Society for Metals, Aluminum Association . (1984), p. 242.

overview.name: Epoxy Resin
overview.description: Epoxy resins, also known as polyepoxides, are a class of reactive prepolymers and polymers which contain epoxide groups. Epoxy resin formulations are important in the electronics industry, and are employed in motors, generators, transformers, switchgear, bushings, insulators, printed wiring boards (PWB), and semiconductor encapsulants. Epoxy resins are excellent electrical insulators and protect electrical components from short circuiting, dust and moisture. In the electronics industry epoxy resins are the primary resin used in overmolding integrated circuits, transistors and hybrid circuits, and making printed circuit boards. The largest volume type of circuit board—an 'FR-4 board'—is a sandwich of layers of glass cloth bonded into a composite by an epoxy resin. Epoxy resins are used to bond copper foil to circuit board substrates, and are a component of the solder mask on many circuit boards.

notes.markdown: Clayton May, 'Epoxy Resins: Chemistry and Technology; (2nd ed.). CRC Press (2018), p. 65.

overview.name: Europium
overview.description: Europium is a silvery-white metal of the lanthanide series that reacts readily with air to form a dark oxide coating. It is the most chemically reactive, least dense, and softest of the lanthanide elements. Europium is one of the rarest of the rare-earth elements on Earth and is (among other things) used for producing the color red in screens.

overview.name: Niobium
overview.description: Niobium is a light grey, crystalline, and ductile transition metal. It can be used to produce capacitors and optical glass, and is widely used in the laser and electronics industries for the production of acoustic filters, optical modulators, mobile phone and computer screens, and other products.
